title: Southern Co. Reports Higher Profit
text:
By Patrick Thomas

Southern Co. (SO) said its profit rose for its third quarter even as revenue declined from a year earlier.

The utility reported a profit of $1.32 billion, or $1.26 a share, compared with $1.16 billion, or $1.14 a share, a year ago.

Analysts were expecting $1.15 a share, according to FactSet.

After adjustments, Southern reported earnings of $1.34 a share.

Total revenue fell to $6 billion from $6.16 billion a year earlier. Analysts had expected $6.18 billion of revenue in the quarter.

Southern reported residential sales, as measured by kilowatt hours, fell nearly 7% in the quarter. Commercial sales and industrial sales were both 7% lower.

Write to Patrick Thomas at patrick.thomas@wsj.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 30, 2019 07:03 ET (11:03 GMT)
